titles.title: To provide for the release of the reversionary interest held by the United States in certain property located in the County of Iosco, Michigan.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Agriculture.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Forestry, Resource Conservation and Research.
Subcommittee on Forestry, Resource Conservation and Research Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Agriculture. H. Rept. 105-35.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 23.

action.text: Mr. Smith (OR) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture.
Senate Committee on Agriculture discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 1/9/1997--Introduced. Requires the Secretary of Agriculture to release the reversionary interest of the United States in a specified parcel of real property conveyed to the County of Iosco, Michigan, in 1960.
